verses.kjv: And it came to pass after these things, that Naboth the Jezreelite had a vineyard, which was in Jezreel, hard by the palace of Ahab king of Samaria.
verses.web: After these things, Naboth the Jezreelite had a vineyard, which was in Jezreel, next to the palace of Ahab king of Samaria.
verses.ct: Some time later, a man named Naboth the Jezreelite owned a vineyard in Jezreel, right next to the palace of King Ahab of Samaria.

verses.kjv: And Ahab spake unto Naboth, saying, Give me thy vineyard, that I may have it for a garden of herbs, because it is near unto my house: and I will give thee for it a better vineyard than it; or, if it seem good to thee, I will give thee the worth of it in money.
verses.web: Ahab spoke to Naboth, saying, “Give me your vineyard, that I may have it for a garden of herbs, because it is near my house; and I will give you for it a better vineyard than it. Or, if it seems good to you, I will give you its worth in money.”
verses.ct: Ahab said to Naboth, "Give me your vineyard so I can turn it into a vegetable garden — it's right next to my palace. I'll give you a better vineyard in exchange, or if you prefer, I'll pay you whatever it's worth in silver."

verses.kjv: And Naboth said to Ahab, The LORD forbid it me, that I should give the inheritance of my fathers unto thee.
verses.web: Naboth said to Ahab, “May LORD forbid me, that I should give the inheritance of my fathers to you!”
verses.ct: But Naboth replied, "The LORD forbid that I should hand over my family's inheritance to you!"

verses.kjv: And Ahab came into his house heavy and displeased because of the word which Naboth the Jezreelite had spoken to him: for he had said, I will not give thee the inheritance of my fathers. And he laid him down upon his bed, and turned away his face, and would eat no bread.
verses.web: Ahab came into his house sullen and angry because of the word which Naboth the Jezreelite had spoken to him; for he had said, “I will not give you the inheritance of my fathers.” He laid himself down on his bed, and turned away his face, and would eat no bread.
verses.ct: Ahab went home sullen and angry because of what Naboth the Jezreelite had told him — that he would not give up his family's inheritance. He threw himself on his bed, turned his face to the wall, and refused to eat.

verses.kjv: But Jezebel his wife came to him, and said unto him, Why is thy spirit so sad, that thou eatest no bread?
verses.web: But Jezebel his wife came to him, and said to him, “Why is your spirit so sad, that you eat no bread?”
verses.ct: His wife Jezebel came to him and asked, "Why are you so upset? Why won't you eat?"

verses.kjv: And he said unto her, Because I spake unto Naboth the Jezreelite, and said unto him, Give me thy vineyard for money; or else, if it please thee, I will give thee another vineyard for it: and he answered, I will not give thee my vineyard.
verses.web: He said to her, “Because I spoke to Naboth the Jezreelite, and said to him, ‘Give me your vineyard for money; or else, if it pleases you, I will give you another vineyard for it.’ He answered, ‘I will not give you my vineyard.’ ”
verses.ct: He told her, "I spoke to Naboth the Jezreelite and said, 'Sell me your vineyard, or if you'd rather, I'll trade you another vineyard for it.' But he said, 'I will not give you my vineyard.'"

verses.kjv: And Jezebel his wife said unto him, Dost thou now govern the kingdom of Israel? arise, and eat bread, and let thine heart be merry: I will give thee the vineyard of Naboth the Jezreelite.
verses.web: Jezebel his wife said to him, “Do you now govern the kingdom of Israel? Arise, and eat bread, and let your heart be merry. I will give you the vineyard of Naboth the Jezreelite.”
verses.ct: Jezebel said to him, "Aren't you the king of Israel? Get up, eat something, and cheer up. I'll get you Naboth's vineyard myself."

verses.kjv: So she wrote letters in Ahab’s name, and sealed them with his seal, and sent the letters unto the elders and to the nobles that were in his city, dwelling with Naboth.
verses.web: So she wrote letters in Ahab’s name, and sealed them with his seal, and sent the letters to the elders and to the nobles who were in his city, who lived with Naboth.
verses.ct: So she wrote letters in Ahab's name, sealed them with his royal seal, and sent them to the elders and nobles who lived in Naboth's city.

verses.kjv: And she wrote in the letters, saying, Proclaim a fast, and set Naboth on high among the people:
verses.web: She wrote in the letters, saying, “Proclaim a fast, and set Naboth on high among the people.
verses.ct: In the letters she wrote, "Proclaim a day of fasting and give Naboth a seat of honor among the people.

verses.kjv: And set two men, sons of Belial, before him, to bear witness against him, saying, Thou didst blaspheme God and the king. And then carry him out, and stone him, that he may die.
verses.web: Set two men, wicked fellows, before him, and let them testify against him, saying, ‘You cursed God and the king!’ Then carry him out, and stone him to death.”
verses.ct: Then seat 2 worthless men across from him and have them testify against him, saying, 'You cursed God and the king!' Then take him outside and stone him to death."

verses.kjv: And the men of his city, even the elders and the nobles who were the inhabitants in his city, did as Jezebel had sent unto them, and as it was written in the letters which she had sent unto them.
verses.web: The men of his city, even the elders and the nobles who lived in his city, did as Jezebel had instructed them in the letters which she had written and sent to them.
verses.ct: The elders and nobles of Naboth's city did exactly what Jezebel had instructed in the letters she sent them.

verses.kjv: They proclaimed a fast, and set Naboth on high among the people.
verses.web: They proclaimed a fast, and set Naboth on high among the people.
verses.ct: They proclaimed a fast and gave Naboth a prominent seat among the people.

verses.kjv: And there came in two men, children of Belial, and sat before him: and the men of Belial witnessed against him, even against Naboth, in the presence of the people, saying, Naboth did blaspheme God and the king. Then they carried him forth out of the city, and stoned him with stones, that he died.
verses.web: The two men, the wicked fellows, came in and sat before him. The wicked fellows testified against him, even against Naboth, in the presence of the people, saying, “Naboth cursed God and the king!” Then they carried him out of the city and stoned him to death with stones.
verses.ct: Then 2 worthless men came in and sat facing him. They testified against Naboth in front of everyone, saying, "Naboth cursed God and the king!" So they dragged him outside the city and stoned him to death.

verses.kjv: Then they sent to Jezebel, saying, Naboth is stoned, and is dead.
verses.web: Then they sent to Jezebel, saying, “Naboth has been stoned, and is dead.”
verses.ct: Then they sent word to Jezebel: "Naboth has been stoned. He is dead."

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when Jezebel heard that Naboth was stoned, and was dead, that Jezebel said to Ahab, Arise, take possession of the vineyard of Naboth the Jezreelite, which he refused to give thee for money: for Naboth is not alive, but dead.
verses.web: When Jezebel heard that Naboth had been stoned, and was dead, Jezebel said to Ahab, “Arise, take possession of the vineyard of Naboth the Jezreelite, which he refused to give you for money; for Naboth is not alive, but dead.”
verses.ct: As soon as Jezebel heard that Naboth had been stoned to death, she told Ahab, "Get up and take possession of the vineyard that Naboth the Jezreelite refused to sell you. Naboth is no longer alive — he's dead."

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when Ahab heard that Naboth was dead, that Ahab rose up to go down to the vineyard of Naboth the Jezreelite, to take possession of it.
verses.web: When Ahab heard that Naboth was dead, Ahab rose up to go down to the vineyard of Naboth the Jezreelite, to take possession of it.
verses.ct: When Ahab heard that Naboth was dead, he got up and went down to Naboth's vineyard to claim it as his own.

verses.kjv: And the word of the LORD came to Elijah the Tishbite, saying,
verses.web: LORD’s word came to Elijah the Tishbite, saying,
verses.ct: Then the word of the LORD came to Elijah the Tishbite:

verses.kjv: Arise, go down to meet Ahab king of Israel, which is in Samaria: behold, he is in the vineyard of Naboth, whither he is gone down to possess it.
verses.web: “Arise, go down to meet Ahab king of Israel, who dwells in Samaria. Behold, he is in the vineyard of Naboth, where he has gone down to take possession of it.
verses.ct: "Go down and confront King Ahab of Israel, who lives in Samaria. He is in Naboth's vineyard right now, taking possession of it.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt speak unto him, saying, Thus saith the LORD, Hast thou killed, and also taken possession? And thou shalt speak unto him, saying, Thus saith the LORD, In the place where dogs licked the blood of Naboth shall dogs lick thy blood, even thine.
verses.web: You shall speak to him, saying, ‘LORD says, “Have you killed and also taken possession?” ’ You shall speak to him, saying, ‘LORD says, “In the place where dogs licked the blood of Naboth, dogs will lick your blood, even yours.” ’ ”
verses.ct: Tell him, 'This is what the LORD says: Have you murdered a man and seized his property?' Then tell him, 'This is what the LORD says: In the very spot where dogs licked up Naboth's blood, dogs will lick up your blood — yes, yours.'"

verses.kjv: And Ahab said to Elijah, Hast thou found me, O mine enemy? And he answered, I have found thee: because thou hast sold thyself to work evil in the sight of the LORD.
verses.web: Ahab said to Elijah, “Have you found me, my enemy?” He answered, “I have found you, because you have sold yourself to do that which is evil in LORD’s sight.
verses.ct: Ahab said to Elijah, "So you've found me, my enemy." Elijah answered, "Yes, I have — because you have sold yourself to do evil in God's eyes.

verses.kjv: Behold, I will bring evil upon thee, and will take away thy posterity, and will cut off from Ahab him that pisseth against the wall, and him that is shut up and left in Israel,
verses.web: Behold, I will bring evil on you, and will utterly sweep you away and will cut off from Ahab everyone who urinates against a wall, and him who is shut up and him who is left at large in Israel.
verses.ct: "The LORD says, 'I am going to bring disaster on you. I will wipe out your descendants and cut off every male in Ahab's line — whether slave or free — in Israel.

verses.kjv: And will make thine house like the house of Jeroboam the son of Nebat, and like the house of Baasha the son of Ahijah, for the provocation wherewith thou hast provoked me to anger, and made Israel to sin.
verses.web: I will make your house like the house of Jeroboam the son of Nebat, and like the house of Baasha the son of Ahijah for the provocation with which you have provoked me to anger, and have made Israel to sin.”
verses.ct: I will make your dynasty like the dynasty of Jeroboam son of Nebat and like the dynasty of Baasha son of Ahijah, because you have provoked me to anger and led Israel into sin.'

verses.kjv: And of Jezebel also spake the LORD, saying, The dogs shall eat Jezebel by the wall of Jezreel.
verses.web: LORD also spoke of Jezebel, saying, “The dogs will eat Jezebel by the rampart of Jezreel.
verses.ct: The LORD also said this about Jezebel: 'Dogs will devour Jezebel by the wall of Jezreel.'

verses.kjv: Him that dieth of Ahab in the city the dogs shall eat; and him that dieth in the field shall the fowls of the air eat.
verses.web: The dogs will eat he who dies of Ahab in the city; and the birds of the sky will eat he who dies in the field.”
verses.ct: Any of Ahab's family who dies in the city will be eaten by dogs, and any who dies in the open country will be eaten by birds."

verses.kjv: But there was none like unto Ahab, which did sell himself to work wickedness in the sight of the LORD, whom Jezebel his wife stirred up.
verses.web: But there was no one like Ahab, who sold himself to do that which was evil in LORD’s sight, whom Jezebel his wife stirred up.
verses.ct: There was never anyone like Ahab, who sold himself to do evil in God's eyes, urged on by his wife Jezebel.

verses.kjv: And he did very abominably in following idols, according to all things as did the Amorites, whom the LORD cast out before the children of Israel.
verses.web: He did very abominably in following idols, according to all that the Amorites did, whom LORD cast out before the children of Israel.
verses.ct: He acted in the most disgusting ways by chasing after idols, just as the Amorites had done — the people the LORD had driven out before Israel.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when Ahab heard those words, that he rent his clothes, and put sackcloth upon his flesh, and fasted, and lay in sackcloth, and went softly.
verses.web: When Ahab heard those words, he tore his clothes, and put sackcloth on his flesh, and fasted, and lay in sackcloth, and went softly.
verses.ct: When Ahab heard these words, he tore his clothes, put on sackcloth against his skin, fasted, slept in sackcloth, and walked around in grief.

verses.kjv: And the word of the LORD came to Elijah the Tishbite, saying,
verses.web: LORD’s word came to Elijah the Tishbite, saying,
verses.ct: Then the word of the LORD came to Elijah the Tishbite:

verses.kjv: Seest thou how Ahab humbleth himself before me? because he humbleth himself before me, I will not bring the evil in his days: but in his son’s days will I bring the evil upon his house.
verses.web: “See how Ahab humbles himself before me? Because he humbles himself before me, I will not bring the evil in his days; but I will bring the evil on his house in his son’s day.”
verses.ct: "Do you see how Ahab has humbled himself before me? Because he has humbled himself, I will not bring this disaster during his lifetime. Instead, I will bring it on his family during his son's reign."
